channel.description: Recent content in PLANit-Java manual on PLANit

item.title: Docs: Examples
item.description:
Here we provide you with a number of representative examples.

In the Java implementation of PLANit, we make a distinction between a project and an assignment run. To conduct an assignment it must be part of the project and source its inputs from the inputs registered on the project.

Because of this two-tiered approach, the examples section is split in multipl sections, each with a focus on a particular aspect of the PLANit run. Currently we have example sections for

  • Setting up a project
  • Providing initial costs
  • Setting up traffic assignments
  • Setting up outputs
  • Setting up inputs

Each section focuses on the options for its area of focus and relies on the defaults for the other components where possible.
